resources.string: This app will help you navigate the world\'s largest community-driven Android conference
Quickly make and manage your schedule to stay on track
This session conflicts with another session in your schedule

Droidcon conferences around the world support the Android platform and create a global network for developers and companies.\n\nWe offer best-in-class presentations from leaders in all parts of the Android ecosystem, including core development, embedded solutions, augmented reality, business solutions, and games.

The Droidcon app is coded in-house by the touchlab team. Worked on by Liam, Izzy, Sam, Ramona, David, Sufei, Kachi and Kevin.

It’s a bit of an experiment, written largely in Kotlin, and including a new(ish) ORM framework. Fun stuff.

The code is open source, at:
https://github.com/touchlab/DroidconApp

Touchlab is a developer founded and run development shop focused on building amazing Android experiences with great design as a foundational principle.

We’re a group of Android experts who believe that Android can and must be better.

We believe that what we built yesterday was great, but what we build with you tomorrow will be even better.

And we’re currently hiring. Want to join a team where Android isn’t that other platform, where we care about pushing our favorite technology forward, and where you can get more involved with the community at large? Get in touch.

http://touchlab.co
Turn on notifications for sessions in your schedule?
Know when new versions of the app are released
